title: Email sent to Judge PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) from Kevin Riford regarding Christina Little

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Email sent to Judge PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) from Kevin Riford regarding Christina Little
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.) Any and all emails received by PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) from sender Kevin Riford (kevinriford@outlook.com) on 6/25/2024.

2.) Any and all emails sent from PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) to Kevin Riford (kevinriford@outlook.com) 6/25/2024.

3.) Any and all emails received by PAULA L. FEROLETO (pferolet@nycourts.gov) from sender Kevin Riford (kevinriford@outlook.com) on 6/27/2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Riford Family

title: Government Employee Salary Data (Louisiana Workforce Commission)

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Government Employee Salary Data (Louisiana Workforce Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the most recent database maintained by this agency detailing government employee compensation across the state.

I am specifically requesting that this release include, for each State employee, the following: Name of Employee, Age, Gender, Ethnicity, Job Title, Agency/department, City/location in which employee is stationed, and Earnings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam

title: Vinh Tang Email Metadata

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Vinh Tang Email Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by Vinh Tang between 9/15/23 and 11/8/23 inclusive:
- Sender
- Recipient (To, CC, BCC)
- Date and time sent
- Subject

As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Seattle Information Technology :: C187579-062624
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on June 26, 2024 and is appended below. 
 
The reference number for this request is C187579-062624. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 166308-88469876@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime! 
 
Request C187579-062624:  
" To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by Vinh Tang between 9/15/23 and 11/8/23 inclusive:
- Sender
- Recipient (To, CC, BCC)
- Date and time sent
- Subject

As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: request for name change document

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: request for name change document
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I changed my name when I became a U.S. citizen in Honolulu in 2006.
I need the original certificate court order for my name change.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

MIKI HYUN

title: Becky Boyer FOIA Request

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Becky Boyer FOIA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In response to my request regarding who requested Jeff and Amner Aguirre's records you stated that Becky Boyer did on 02/12/2024, can you please tell me when you responded to this request with the requested information?

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

communications.subject: Welcome to the Open Records Request Portal!
communications.communication:
Dear Bernadette Feazell, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Open Records Request Portal. 
 
Your Login ID is:  166246-04683032@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request.

title: San Jose Cease and Desist

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: San Jose Cease and Desist
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Administrative Nuisance Abatement as described in Chapter 1.13 of the city code.

Please provide any and all nuisance abatement cease and desist orders (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) from January 1, 2024 to the date this request is filed. This should include documents used to determine whether the property is considered a nuisance. 


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Public Records Request - City :: R005047-062624
communications.communication:
Dear : 
The City is in receipt of your Public Records Act Request which you submitted on 6/26/2024. Your request was given the reference number R005047-062624 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Administrative Nuisance Abatement as described in Chapter 1.13 of the city code.
Please provide any and all nuisance abatement cease and desist orders (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) from January 1, 2024 to the date this request is filed. This should include documents used to determine whether the property is considered a nuisance. 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa 
Our staff is currently searching for and collecting documents. We will notify you by 7/8/2024 of disclosable public records.  We will, at that time, also inform you of the costs incurred by the City in copying the responsive documents. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of San Jose To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center

title: Arrest of Bruce Guthrie (Edmonds Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Arrest of Bruce Guthrie (Edmonds Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any incident report, narrative, or similar report concerning the detention or arrest of Bruce Guthrie on June 14, 2024 at or near the the Frances Anderson Play Field.

2. Any body camera, vehicle camera, or similar recording depicting the detention, arrest, or transportation of Bruce Guthrie on June 14, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Adam Steinbaugh, 

Thank you for registering with the City of Edmonds, WA Public Records Center. 
Your Login ID is:  166206-39083884@requests.muckrock.com 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may Request a Temporary Password. (https://edmondswa.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/forgotpassword.aspx) 
Please login to " My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. (https://edmondswa.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/CustomerHome.aspx?sSessionID=[SESSIONS_ID]) 
Thank You, 
City of Edmonds, WA

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: W012920-062624
communications.communication:
Dear Adam Steinbaugh, 

Thank you for your interest in obtaining public records from Edmonds Police Department.  Your request has been received and is being processed.  Your request was received in this office on June 26, 2024and given the reference number W012920-062624 for tracking purposes. 

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any incident report, narrative, or similar report concerning the detention or arrest of Bruce Guthrie on June 14, 2024 at or near the the Frances Anderson Play Field.

2. Any body camera, vehicle camera, or similar recording depicting the detention, arrest, or transportation of Bruce Guthrie on June 14, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: County Public Records :: K137330-062624
communications.communication:
Dear Adam Steinbaugh: 
Your request has been received by our request portal system and has been assigned tracking number K137330-062624. Please use this number in any future communications concerning this request. 
We will be assessing your request to determine the following: 
 
  * If the request is seeking Court records to be processed under the Access to Administrative Records GR 31.1 
  * If the request is seeking records available under the Public Records Act chapter 42.56 RCW, or is seeking information held by the County. 
  * If the request is seeking records held by another agency. 
  * Which Snohomish County department is best suited to be your point of contact. 
Please anticipate hearing from the assigned department within five business days. 
 Your Request Information 
Description of Request: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any incident report, narrative, or similar report concerning the detention or arrest of Bruce Guthrie on June 14, 2024 at or near the the Frances Anderson Play Field.

2. Any body camera, vehicle camera, or similar recording depicting the detention, arrest, or transportation of Bruce Guthrie on June 14, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fsnohomish-county-sheriffs-office-556%252Farrest-of-bruce-guthrie-snohomish-county-sheriffs-office-166205%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAduyDHmqfnpx8esL3RnzCbVqQ%3A1sMfVY%3AifR3aGDUxPhE35GLODyJa5GKb-yJfXdueH10o3o5muc 
Snohomish County, Office of Public Records 
NOTICE: All emails, and attachments, sent to and from Snohomish County are public records and may be subject to disclosure pursuant to the Public Records Act (RCW 42.56) 
 
To view your request please visit the My Records Center. ([CUSTOMER_HOME_HREF])

title: Missouri camping ban correspondence

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Missouri camping ban correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All e-mail communications (including complete email chains, email attachments, calendar invitations, and calendar invitation attachments sent or received by Rep. Peggy McGaugh, Rep. Jamie Burger, Rep. Andrew McDaniel, or Rep. Bruce DeGroot that a) contains the terms "Cicero," "housing," "camping," "shelter," or "homeless" and b) was sent or received between 6/1/2021 and 8/1/2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Burns

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Missouri camping ban correspondence
communications.communication:
Ms. Burns, I am responding to your request for records dated June 25, 2024. The House of Representatives is not the custodian of records of individual representatives. The Missouri Constitution, Article III, Section 19, states that “Each member of the general assembly is the custodian of legislative records under the custody and control of the member, their employees and staff.”

The House does not retain the email reocords of former representatives McDaniel or DeGroot. For current representatives McGaugh and Burger, you may wish to contact the representative’s office directly for assistance; the contact information may be found here: https://house.mo.gov/MemberRoster.aspx

Thank you,

Bryan D. Scheiderer
General Counsel
Missouri House of Representatives
(573) 522-2639

communications.communication:

title: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (Bel Air Police Department)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (Bel Air Police Department)
Online Form Submittal: Maryland Public Information Act Request Form
communications.communication:
The following form was submitted via your website: Maryland Public Information Act Request Form


Date: 06/27/2024

First Name: Deborah

Last Name: Levi

Address 1: MuckRock News, DEPT MR166111

Address 2: 263 Huntington Ave

City: Boston

State: Massachusetts

Zip Code: 02115

Phone: 617-299-1832

Email: 166111-15181337@requests.muckrock.com

List the requested public records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records for every sworn officer and civilian member of the Bel Air Police Department for fiscal year 2023 and fiscal year 2024:

1. First and last name;
2. Unique sequence number;
3. Race;
4. Gender;
5. Hire date;
6. 2023 salary;
7. 2023 overtime;
8. 2024 salary;
9. 2024 overtime.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Alternatively, please consider waiving any fees, pursuant to § 4-206(e)(2)(ii) of the General Provisions Article, as this request is on behalf of individuals served by the Maryland Office of the Public Defender, a state government agency, which solely serves indigent citizens of Maryland. As a result, my request for the above-listed public records is in the public interest. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Deborah Levi
Director of Special Litigation
Maryland Office of the Public Defender
(443) 272-1068

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fpolice-department-28174%252Frequest-for-your-agencys-2023-2024-roster-salary-data-bel-air-police-department-166111%252F%253Femail%253Dmkrantz%252540belairmd.org&url_auth_token=AAGU9iPxojIiyrREU_fiNaM6p9Y%3A1sMg7l%3AbzMp9lf-j1eXXXpT5Wpk2TpEjQVfZcOHrtyLbOo72Ds

title: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (St. Mary's County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (St. Mary's County Sheriff)
RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (St. Mary's County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Ms. Levi,

We received your Public Information Act request however the Fiscal Year 2024 has not yet closed.  Do you want the report run through the current date for 2024 or do you wish to wait until after the Fiscal Year for 2024 has ended?  Our Fiscal Year ends on June 30, 2024.

Thank you,


Karen M. Moore
St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office
Coordinator III
Office of Professional Responsibilities, Internal Affairs
Work: (301)475-4200 extension 1903
Karen.Moore@stmaryscountymd.gov<mailto:Karen.Moore@stmarysmd.com>
This electronic message transmission contains information that may be confidential or privileged.  The information is intended to be for the use of the individual or entity named above.  If you have received this communication in error, please re-send this communication to the sender and delete the original message and any copy of it from your computer system. Thank you.

communications.subject: FW: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (St. Mary's County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Levi,

Per our conversation this morning, I am sending this email request to your work email so that you can discuss with your paralegal and advise us at your earliest convenience if you would like your  Public Information Act request for the Salary Data for  Fiscal Year 2024 run through the current date or do you wish to wait until after the Fiscal Year for 2024 has ended?  Our Fiscal Year ends on June 30, 2024.    I just need to let our Finance Department know so that they can run the report.

Best regards,


Karen M. Moore
St. Mary's County Sheriff's Office
Coordinator III
Office of Professional Responsibilities, Internal Affairs
Work: (301)475-4200 extension 1903
Karen.Moore@stmaryscountymd.gov<mailto:Karen.Moore@stmarysmd.com>
This electronic message transmission contains information that may be confidential or privileged.  The information is intended to be for the use of the individual or entity named above.  If you have received this communication in error, please re-send this communication to the sender and delete the original message and any copy of it from your computer system. Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2023-2024 Roster & Salary Data (St. Mary's County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Moore,
Thank you for following up with this inquiry! Yes, please wait till the end of your 2024 fiscal year to run the report. 
Thanks very much!
Amelia McDonell-Parry
Office of the Public Defender

communications.communication:
Deborah Levi,

Please be advised that our agency now utilizes an online system, GovQuest, and we no longer accept PIA requests by email as stated on our website.  You can submit a request and make payment online by using GovQuest, by mail, or in person (along with payment) at our Headquarters, located at 45 S. Main St., Bel Air, MD, 21014.

Sincerely,


Michelle Hanks
Harford County Sheriff’s Office
Public Information Act Liaison
Office: 443-409-3403 (33403)
Email:  hanksm@harfordsheriff.org<mailto:hanksm@harfordsheriff.org>
